title: GAPKI: 16.5m Indonesian Families Rely On Palm Oil Industry
GAPKI, PPKS Conduct Palm Training For Tanzanian Participants
BNI speeds approvals as centralised trade platform takes hold
Antam Gold Edges Lower After Monday’s Record Surge
body: Antam gold slips Rp 1,000 after hitting an all-time high, while global prices stay strong on safe-haven demand.

title: EU Signals Trade Pact Talks with ASEAN to Begin After 2027
body: The EU wishes to focus on sealing bilateral trade deals with the individual ASEAN members first before discussing a regional pact.

title: JCI Edges Lower as BI Appointment Raises Questions for Investors
body: The benchmark index edged down at the open as investors weighed BI leadership changes against global market volatility.

title: Energi Mega Persada Strikes Oil in Malacca Strait Block
body: ENRG says a new oil find by its subsidiary could add up to 31 million barrels.

title: Rupiah Moves Higher as Markets Weigh Signals, Economist Urges Caution
body: The rupiah strengthened as markets weighed global risks, while an economist urged policymakers to treat market moves as early warnings.

title: IMF Praise Helps JCI Finish Higher Amid Volatility and Global Caution
body: IMF praise lifted the JCI to close in the green, even as volatility persisted and investors stayed wary ahead of global policy cues.

title: End of EV Incentives Signals Policy Shift in Indonesia, Expert Says
body: As EV incentives end, experts urge Indonesia to shift from subsidies to structural rules for a self-sustaining market.

title: Indonesia Offers New Retail Bonds with Up to 5.8% Annual Returns
body: Indonesia launches ORI029 retail bonds, targeting Rp 25 trillion for the 2026 budget, with fixed monthly coupons of up to 5.8%.

title: Private Sector Key to Achieving 6–8% Growth, Deputy Finance Minister Says
body: Indonesia’s 6–8% growth dream won’t be funded by the state budget alone, with 85% of the economy driven by the private sector.

title: Antam Gold Hits Fresh Record as Global Rally Nears $5,000 an Ounce
body: Antam gold hit a new record as the global rally neared $5,000 an ounce on strong safe-haven demand.

title: JCI Starts Week in Green, Tracking Global and Fed Cues
body: JCI opened higher on Monday with positive market breadth, as investors tracked mixed global markets and awaited this week’s Fed's meeting.

title: Indonesia to Set Tin Reference Price to Stabilize Market
body: Indonesia will soon set a minimum reference price for tin to stabilize markets, protect local miners, and support downstream investment.

title: Scrapping EV Incentives May Be Premature, Analysts Warn
body: Analysts warn ending Indonesia’s EV incentives may be premature, arguing they are a long-term investment despite limited subsidy savings.

title: Russia Says Eurasia-Indonesia Deal is Proof It Seeks Free Trade, Not Tariff Hikes
body: In a world hit by US tariffs, Indonesia has signed a free trade agreement with the Russia-led Eurasian Economic Union (EAEU).

title: Indonesia Records 1.4 Billion-Liter Surplus in Diesel Supply
body: Indonesia has recorded a 1.4 billion-liter surplus in subsidized diesel supply, driven by rising biodiesel use and refinery output.

title: Indonesia Says No More C48 Diesel Imports in 2026
body: Indonesia will stop C48 diesel imports in 2026, while gasoline imports continue until 2027.

title: Investment Minister Sees Blended Finance as Key to AI Investment
body: Blended finance is key to keeping Indonesia competitive in the global AI race, Investment Minister Rosan Roeslani says.

title: JCI Extends Pullback on Heavy Foreign Selling
body: Foreign selling and global uncertainty pushed the JCI down 0.46% on Friday, with market breadth firmly negative.

title: Danantara Could Add Lasting Boost to Economy, Indef Says
body: Danantara could give a lasting boost to Indonesia’s economy by lifting productivity and long-term capital formation, Indef said.

title: Economist Urges Caution Over Plan to Add New Cigarette Excise Layer
body: An economist warned the planned new cigarette excise tier could backfire if poorly designed.
